summary: The International Labour Conference (ILC) is a pivotal forum convened by the International Labour Organization (ILO), which is a specialized agency of the United Nations. This annual conference brings together representatives from governments, employers, and workers to discuss and establish international labor standards. In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, the ILC plays a crucial role in shaping labor policies that member states are encouraged to adopt. The outcomes of the conference influence EU directives and regulations, promoting social justice and fair labor practices across the Union, thereby enhancing the protection of workers' rights and fostering equitable labor conditions.
